◆ get_display_mode_support()

DisplayModeSupport DeckLink::DeviceOutputInterface::get_display_mode_support ( const DisplayMode &  display_mode,
const PixelFormat  pixel_format,
const VideoOutputFlags  output_flags = VideoOutputFlags::Default 
)

How is the specified Image Format + Pixel Format combination supported by the hardware ?

Whilst DeviceOutputInterface::supports_pixel_format only tells you whether a display mode is supported or not this function allows you to differentiate between supported and supproted with conversion.

Parameters
display_modeThe Image Format to try
pixel_formatThe associated pixel format
output_flagsThe associated VideoOutputFlags
Returns
Whether the combination is supported by the device

Definition at line 366 of file device_output_interface.cpp.

◆ set_opacity() [1/2]

DeviceOutputInterface & DeckLink::DeviceOutputInterface::set_opacity ( const float  level)

Set the opacity of the keyed images.

This is in addition to any opacity specified in the alpha channel of the keyed images.

Parameters
levelThe opacity as a number between 0.0 and 1.0 where 0.0 is fully transparent and 1.0 is fully opaque. Values out of this range will cause an out_of_range error to be thrown.
Returns
this (for method chaining)

Definition at line 356 of file device_output_interface.cpp.

◆ set_opacity() [2/2]

DeviceOutputInterface & DeckLink::DeviceOutputInterface::set_opacity ( const uint8_t  level)

Set the opacity of the keyed images.

This is in addition to any opacity specified in the alpha channel of the keyed images.

Parameters
levelThe opacity as a number between 0 and 255 where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque.
Returns
this (for method chaining)
